title: Tool besides ida to get high level code
content:
I looking another tool besides ida to get high level code from binary file.(like oda pesudocode)

I know that the high level is not perfect on every tool, but I want try another tool.

My code compile to arm.

answers_data.content:
Try the Retargetable Decompiler .

hugsy has developed a Binary Ninja plugin to decompile binaries using the RetDec API called binja-retdec .

comments.text: @SYS_Y what Retargetable Decompiler diffrent than Binary Ninja. Witxh better? And they bettwr than ida psudocode??
RetDec only works at present with 32-bit binaries. It has a 32-bit IDA Pro plugin for generating either C or pseudo-code.

answers_data.content: If you are using a Mac or Linux, hopper is a product worth checking out.

Currently nothing beats the quality of IDA’s ARM decompiler.

But if you are on a budget, BinaryNinja’s medium level IL is actually quite pleasant to read. And in my experience it’s correct (while retdec’s C code is sometimes just plain wrong).

The JEB guys have entered the decompiler business with a MIPS decompiler (which HexRays doesn’t offer at the moment). Supposedly it’s quite good. And they have a ARM decompiler in open beta now. I have not tried it yet, but it’s good to see competition.
If you on Windows then Relyze Desktop contains a decompiler for ARM binaries (As well as ARM64/x86/x64).
